"zstring_" Simple string API

A simple string API with class-like semantics. More...

Detailed Description

A simple string API with class-like semantics.

Function Documentation

size_t zstring_alloc (  T_zstring *    z,
size_t    len
) 
 

ensure that the string buffer is at least len+1

Note:
zstring_set() is free to resize the buffer if it is much larger strlen, which will invalidate the zstring_alloc()
Parameters:
z  the T_zstring to add to
len  the minimum required length, or 0 to get the current length
Returns:
the max strlen which will fit into the currently allocated str buffer

void zstring_cat (  T_zstring *    z,
const char *    s_arg
) 
 

concatenate the passed string to the T_zstring

Parameters:
z  the T_zstring to add to
s_arg  the string to add, or NULL for ""

T_zstring* zstring_create (  const char *    s ) 
 

Creator for T_zstring

Parameters:
s  initial string value, NULL for empty string ""
Returns:
the created T_zstring

void zstring_destroy (  T_zstring *    z ) 
 

Destroyer for T_zstring

Parameters:
z  the T_zstring to destroy

const char* zstring_get (  T_zstring *    z ) 
 

The accessor for the string value

Parameters:
z  the T_zstring to access
Returns:
the string value

void zstring_pad (  T_zstring *    z,
int    c,
size_t    len
) 
 

pad the string with the given number of the passed character

Parameters:
z  the T_zstring to pad
c  the pad character (cast to unsigned char)
len  the number of c characters to append to z

void zstring_set (  T_zstring *    z,
const char *    s_arg
) 
 

Set the T_zstring to a copy of the passed string

Note:
resets buffer length if > 2x strlen, invalidating the last zstring_alloc()
Parameters:
z  the T_zstring to set
s_arg  the string to copy, or NULL for ""
